result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark H Winter was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $850 has been applied. Remaining fine/costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.  Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Sentence to commence forthwith.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

RE: Work Release and Good Time Credit

10:49 am case called. Defendant Mark H Winter in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motion filed by DA. Defendant has received motion. Court questions defendant regrarding requests by DA Blader. Statement by defendant regarding motion. Court questions defendant further-does not disagree with allegation in motion. Court makes a statement regrarding material facts and enters an order revoking the defendant's Huber priviledges for the remainder of the sentence and nullifies the defendant's ability to transfer the sentence.
Motion hearing on May 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
State's Motion to Revoke Work Release Privileges

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:36 p.m. Defendant Mark H Winter in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. 15TR3120 & 15TR3121 - DRI. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding sentencing. Statement by DE. Court orders: 75 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, $2452 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP,  31 month DL rev/31 month IID, OWI Assessment, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  The Court does not object to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.

from DE requesting a two week adjournment
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-04-2016 02:00 pm

Case called @ 1:44 p.m. Defendant Mark H Winter in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears again without counsel. Statement by DE - unable to reach the attorney that he paid the deposit through and the attorney is no longer in business. Defendant is requesting court appointed counsel. The DE will speak with DA Blader prior to obtaining representation. The Court finds that there has been a waiver of counsel at this point in the proceeding. Recess for the parties to talk. 

Case recalled @ 1:57 p.m. DA Blader - The parties have reached a resolution. DA Blader places the offer on the record. DE is requesting time to contemplate the offer and is requesting a subsequent date for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference at 02-29-2016 01:45 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

All 3 Cases Called @ 3:03 PM: Defendant Mark H Winter in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and states he thought his attorney would be here today - retainer fee paid approx 3 weeks ago.  NGP entered by Court as to all matters.   Court orders a cash bond of $850 - already posted.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
